subject: AI & Agents
title: Support Vector Machines and the Kernel Trick
description: A short lesson to help you apply Support Vector Machines and the Kernel Trick.

hook.text: Two groups of data points are hopelessly tangled. No straight line can separate them.

buildup.text: Support Vector Machines find the optimal boundary between categories in data.

discovery.text: The 'kernel trick' projects data into a higher dimension where a clean separator suddenly appears.

twist.text: It's like lifting tangled strings off a table â€” they separate when you add a third dimension.

climax.text: SVMs dominated machine learning competitions throughout the late 1990s and early 2000s.

punchline.text: Can't separate them here? Lift them higher.

quiz.question: What does the kernel trick do?
options: Projects data into higher dimensions to find separating boundaries
